item.title: Mentioned by Windsor Star
item.description:
Conservative MPs face review over election spending
Liberal MP Scott Andrews had argued that the Conservative MPs, Shelly Glover and James Bezan, ought not to be voting or sitting in the House after chief electoral officer Marc Mayrand notified Scheer that they had not filed complete returns for their 2011 ...

item.title: Mentioned by Huffington Post Canada
item.description:
Tory MP Bows To Elections Canada In Fight Over Expenses
Liberal MP Scott Andrews had raised a question of privilege with Scheer, arguing that he needed to act on that rule and let the House decide whether to bar the MPs until they settled their disputes with Elections Canada, either with the agency or in court.
